moves.1. e4: This game is one I thought I played fairly well. It is good to have luck on your side also. Kings Opening. I am especially weak playing as black. Partially because the guy that got me into playing chess always let me start the games as white. I played probably 300 games as white before I ever played a game as black. Feel free to comment or point out a move I missed or even how lucky I was this game.
moves.1... e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4 Bc5 4. b4 Bxb4: Evans Gambit accepted. All move up to this point are text book moves.
moves.5. c3 Bc5 6. d4 exd4 7. O-O d6 8. cxd4 B: Ulvestad variation. Still all fairly text book moves. But we are close to getting this game rolling.
moves.9... Na5 10. Bb2 Ne7: Paulsen variation. Now we roll right into the game play.
moves.11. Bd3 Bg4: I thought I would go ahead and come out of the gate a little aggresive. I knew I had to jump on gcah2006, to many times allowing the better player to be aggresive I get into trouble fairly quickly.
moves.12. Nbd2 Qd7: This move stops 13. h3. Which would be followed by blacks 13. Bxh3, and opening up the h & g files for a direct attack on the King.
moves.13. Qc2 a6 14. Rac1: White is stacking up on the c file which is starting to make me a little uncomfortable.
moves.14... Rc8: This move was intended to protect c file and provoke 15. Bxg7 opening g file for an attack.
moves.15. Bxg7: It worked. I feel this move helped me gain a tempo (maybe not I'm faily new to this game).
moves.15... Rg8: This is exactly what I wanted here. Whites major pieces are stacked on the queen side and I now have a direct attack to the king.
moves.16. Qb2 Bxf3: An exchange I have to do to get my queen involved in the attack.
moves.17. Nxf3: This move is the one that sealed the deal. I think gxf3 would have been the better move.
moves.17... Qg4 18. g3: h3 would have definitely been stronger here. Regardless White's bishop on g7 is as good as gone.
moves.19... Qxg3+: That's pretty much it. gcah2006 spanked me on our next game. It's crazy how just a couple of bad moves critically changes the game. Thank you Gavin for the game.
